intro: Morisonia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf morisonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes evening primroses and willowherbs. The plant features slender, often hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are typically less than 2 inches in length. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in terminal racemes, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woods and along stream banks.
